title: Authorizes municipalities within a certain county to be authorized to continue to license and regulate the operation of pre-arranged for-hire vehicles
summary: Authorizes municipalities within a certain county to be authorized to continue to license and regulate the operation of pre-arranged for-hire vehicle operations.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1564

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. SCHIMEL -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. HOOPER,
         McDONOUGH, McKEVITT, RAIA, WEISENBERG -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to inter-juris-
         dictional transportation of passengers for hire

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph b of subdivision 1 of section 498 of the  vehicle
    2  and traffic law, as added by chapter 549 of the laws of 2006, is amended
    3  to read as follows:
    4    b. "Licensing jurisdiction" shall mean a city with a population of one
    5  million  or  more,  or a county within New York state contiguous to such
    6  city, that requires the issuance of  a  license,  permit,  registration,
    7  certification  or  other  approval  for  a  vehicle  to perform the pre-
    8  arranged pick up or drop off of one or more passengers in such jurisdic-
    9  tion for compensation OR A VILLAGE, CITY OR TOWN WITHIN SUCH  A  CONTIG-
   10  UOUS  COUNTY,  WHERE  SUCH  COUNTY  IS  COMPRISED OF THREE TOWNS AND TWO
   11  CITIES, AND, WHERE SUCH VILLAGES, CITIES AND TOWNS WERE  REGULATING  THE
   12  OPERATION  OF  PRE-ARRANGED  FOR-HIRE  VEHICLES PRIOR TO JUNE FIRST, TWO
   13  THOUSAND SIX.
   14    S 2. Paragraph a of subdivision 2 of section 498 of  the  vehicle  and
   15  traffic  law, as added by chapter 549 of the laws of 2006, is amended to
   16  read as follows:
   17    a. A pre-arranged for-hire vehicle that is licensed to provide pre-ar-
   18  ranged transportation for compensation by a licensing jurisdiction meet-
   19  ing the standards and requirements set forth in subdivisions three, four
   20  and six of this section shall be authorized to  pick  up  passengers  in
   21  such  jurisdiction for drop off within the same jurisdiction, to pick up
   22  passengers in another licensing jurisdiction for  drop  off  within  the
   23  licensing  jurisdiction licensing such pre-arranged for-hire vehicle, to
   24  drop off passengers in another licensing jurisdiction who were picked up

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01516-01-1

       A. 1564                             2

    1  within the licensing jurisdiction licensing such  pre-arranged  for-hire
    2  vehicle,  and to transit other licensing jurisdictions. No other licens-
    3  ing jurisdiction may require a pre-arranged for-hire  vehicle  providing
    4  pre-arranged  transportation  for  compensation,  which is licensed by a
    5  licensing jurisdiction meeting the standards and requirements set  forth
    6  in subdivisions three, four and six of this section, to also be licensed
    7  by such other licensing jurisdiction or to pay any pre-arranged for-hire
    8  vehicle  license  fee  in  order  to  be  allowed to pick up or drop off
    9  passengers within or to transit such jurisdiction. A licensing jurisdic-
   10  tion meeting the standards and requirements set  forth  in  subdivisions
   11  three,  four  and six of this section shall provide written confirmation
   12  thereof to other licensing jurisdictions, containing information  suffi-
   13  cient to establish that such licensing jurisdiction meets all such stan-
   14  dards  and  requirements,  and  which  shall be verifiable by such other
   15  licensing jurisdictions. Such written confirmation shall be  resubmitted
   16  to such other licensing jurisdictions every three years. FOR PURPOSES OF
   17  THIS SUBDIVISION, SUCH CITIES, VILLAGES, AND TOWNS ACTING AS A LICENSING
   18  JURISDICTION  WITHIN  A  CERTAIN  COUNTY  AS DESCRIBED IN THIS PARAGRAPH
   19  SHALL NOT ISSUE THE WRITTEN CONFIRMATION REQUIRED BY THIS PARAGRAPH, BUT
   20  SUCH WRITTEN CONFIRMATION SHALL BE ISSUED BY SUCH COUNTY PURSUANT TO THE
   21  PROCEDURE CONTAINED IN THIS PARAGRAPH. PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT WITHIN  A
   22  COUNTY  ADJACENT  TO THE CITY OF NEW YORK WHERE SUCH COUNTY IS COMPRISED
   23  OF THREE TOWNS AND TWO CITIES, AND WITHIN  SUCH  COUNTY  THE  TOWNS  AND
   24  CITIES  AND  SEVERAL OF THE INCORPORATED VILLAGES LICENSED AND REGULATED
   25  PRE-ARRANGED FOR-HIRE VEHICLE OPERATIONS PRIOR TO JUNE FIRST, TWO  THOU-
   26  SAND  SIX, SUCH TOWNS, CITIES AND VILLAGES ARE AUTHORIZED TO CONTINUE TO
   27  LICENSE AND REGULATE THE OPERATION OF SUCH  VEHICLES  PURSUANT  TO  THIS
   28  SECTION  PROVIDED  SUCH  TOWN,  CITY  OR VILLAGE MEETS THE STANDARDS AND
   29  REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISIONS  THREE,  FOUR  AND  SIX  OF  THIS
   30  SECTION.  WHEN A PRE-ARRANGED FOR-HIRE VEHICLE HAS BEEN LICENSED BY SUCH
   31  TOWN, CITY OR VILLAGE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STANDARDS AND  REQUIREMENTS
   32  OF SUBDIVISIONS THREE, FOUR AND SIX OF THIS SECTION, THE LICENSING OFFI-
   33  CER OF SUCH TOWN, CITY OR VILLAGE SHALL CERTIFY TO THE LICENSING OFFICER
   34  OF SUCH COUNTY THAT THE REQUIREMENTS OF SUBDIVISIONS THREE, FOUR AND SIX
   35  OF  THIS  SECTION HAVE BEEN MET AND SUCH COUNTY SHALL NOTIFY PURSUANT TO
   36  THIS SUBDIVISION THE OTHER  LICENSING  JURISDICTIONS.  NOTHING  IN  THIS
   37  PARAGRAPH  SHALL  BE  CONSTRUED  AS REQUIRING A TOWN, CITY OR VILLAGE TO
   38  CONTINUE THE REGULATION AND LICENSING OF PRE-ARRANGED FOR-HIRE VEHICLES,
   39  AND SUCH TOWN, CITY OR VILLAGE MAY ELECT TO CEDE SUCH REGULATORY RESPON-
   40  SIBILITIES TO SUCH COUNTY, OR IN THE CASE OF A VILLAGE, TO THE  TOWN  IN
   41  WHICH  IT  IS LOCATED. SUCH COUNTY SHALL ENTER INTO THE APPLICABLE RECI-
   42  PROCITY AGREEMENTS ON BEHALF OF SUCH CITY, TOWN OR VILLAGE AND UPON  THE
   43  CERTIFICATION  OF  THE  LICENSING  OFFICER OF SUCH TOWN, CITY OR VILLAGE
   44  THAT A VEHICLE IS DULY LICENSED, ISSUE A  LICENSE  AS  PROVIDED  FOR  IN
   45  PARAGRAPH  B  OF SUBDIVISION THREE OF THIS SECTION.  SUCH COUNTY, TOWNS,
   46  CITIES AND VILLAGES ARE AUTHORIZED TO ENTER  INTO  SUCH  INTER-MUNICIPAL
   47  AGREEMENTS  AS  MAY  BE  REQUIRED  TO  ENSURE THE ADMINISTRATION OF THIS
   48  SECTION, INCLUDING INTRA-COUNTY RECIPROCAL AGREEMENTS.  IF SUCH VILLAGE,
   49  CITY OR TOWN ELECTS  NOT  TO  REGULATE  PRE-ARRANGED  FOR-HIRE  VEHICLES
   50  PURSUANT  TO  THE  PROVISIONS  OF  THIS SECTION, NOTHING IN THIS SECTION
   51  SHALL BE CONSTRUED AS LIMITING OR NEGATING THE  CONTINUED  AUTHORITY  OF
   52  SUCH  VILLAGES,  CITIES AND TOWNS TO REGULATE CERTAIN FOR-HIRE VEHICLES,
   53  TAXICABS, AND LIMOUSINES PURSUANT  TO  THE  PROVISIONS  OF  SECTION  ONE
   54  HUNDRED EIGHTY-ONE OF THE GENERAL MUNICIPAL LAW.
   55    S 3. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to inter-jurisdictional transportation of passengers for hire
